page.title: 14MANCHESTER SHIP CANAL
page.content: The section of the {Manchester Ship {Canal}which passes through our area is due to close unless other uses or alternative methods of financing it can be found.This quotation is part of a statement released by the{M.S.C {Company}on 11.4.84."The Ship Canal from Eastham to Runcorn is sound and successful and we can keep it so.But our customers there cannot and will not pay for the losses above Runcorn. In 1983 the company lost about Â£2m.on the Ship Canal above Runcorn.In 1984 the loss is likely to be greater. By early 1987 the Sludge Ships will have gone along with important oil traffic. There is no prospect of attracting any thing like the traffic we are losing.. The company is therefore...forced to the conclusion that the{M.S.C}above Runcorn will have to close." Latest news-Loc.Auths.in discussions with{MSC
